intro: Riedlea berteroana, commonly known as the Andean wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, glossy dark green leaves, and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. Riedlea berteroana is often found in humid, high-altitude environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
